question.text:
Match List-I with List-II relating to human female external genitalia.
$\begin{array}{|l|l|r|l|}\hline & \begin{array}{l} \text{List I} \\ \text{(Structures)} \end{array} & & \begin{array}{l} \text{List II} \\ \text{(Features)} \end{array} \\ \hline A. & \text{Mons pubis} & I. & \text{A fleshy fold of tissue surrounding the vaginal opening} \\ \hline B. & \text{Clitoris} & II. & \text{Fatty cushion of cells covered by skin and hair} \\ \hline C. & \text{Hymen} & III. & \text{Tiny finger-like structure above labia minora} \\ \hline D. & \text{Labina majora} & IV. & \text{A thin membrane-like structure covering vaginal opening }\\ \hline \end{array}$

Choose the correct answer from the option given below :

solution.text:
The correct answer is option (1) because
- Mons pubis is a cushion of fatty tissue covered by skin and pubic hair. So (A) matches with (II).
- Clitoris is a tiny finger like structure which lies at the upper junction of the two labia minora above the urethral opening. So, (B) matches with (III)
- Hymen is a membrane which partially covers the opening of vagina., So (C) matches with (IV)
- Labia majora are fleshy folds of tissue which extends down from the mons pubis and surround the vaginal opening. So, (D) matches with (I)
Other options (2), (3) and (4) are incorrect as they represent mismatches for (A), (B), (C) and (D)
